alert.note: Alert for Rhea (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Rhea County through 930 PM EDT... At 840 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Spring City, or 12 miles northwest of Decatur. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spring City, Piney Falls State Park, Grandview and Stinging Fork Falls State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
